channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13579] Avoid isCellTTLExpired() for NO-TAG cases
item.description:
As observed in this JIRA's performance test, we are always calling the isCellTTLExpired() for every cell and internally it is parsing the keyLength, valueLength() to get the tagsLength after which we decide whether Cell level TTL is present are not.

This JIRA aims to avoid this check if all the readers of the storescanner knows that there are no tags to read. Note that, for the memstore scanner we will do that in another JIRA, which I suppose Stack had already raised to avoid tag length while flushing (for the NO-TAG) case.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: That means the check can no longer sit in a static method isCellTTLExpired in HStore ? We wont have the FileScanner reference with us there. The HFileReader can know the tags status by looking at the max tags length META info right?

Another idea I am thinking of is, what we make a new class extending KeyValue in which the getTagsLength is just returning 0 (no parsing nothing). When the getKeyValue() call on HFileReader makes the Cell, we know what is the tags length for that Cell. When the tags length is 0, we will make the Object of the new class (KeyValue extension)

Then noted one more thing. We have in HFileReader
Cell getKeyValue();
Strange name. We missed rename here. As this is private interface we can correct it with out worry I guess. (Just for noting down)

When the tags length is 0, we will make the Object of the new class (KeyValue extension)

Yes this is the way I too thought, per Cell we can decide the tagsLength (by creating new Cell). But thought that then we may have to create two type of cells (one when tags are there and another without tags)
The other option is to pass the info to the StoreScanner level to decide whether to use tags are not. This can be done also.

The other simple idea thought of is just add a new Constructor in KV explicity passing hasTag (true or false). Based on this do getTagsLength() either by parsing or just return 0.
But it would add to the heapSize() of KV (one boolean more).

Also we have another Jira to cache some of the lengths in the Cell impl. I think that is a must as we refine the CellComparator further. May be the getTagsLength solution go in there directly? TagsLength also we will cache? cc stack
I like the KV extension patch seeing how small/simple is the change.

I would be in favor of shoving the info into a new Cell type rather than changing the read path adding flags; the former makes for better encapsulation and hopefully makes the read path traversal more direct.

Thanks for making this a subtask of HBASE-13291. Suggest linking the issue that will tag hfiles when no tags present.
So is it ok to commit the KVExtension patch for this JIRA?

I am +1.
Can we make the new class a public one (I mean not an inner class). This will be InterfaceAudience Private only any way.
Get a QA run for that patch?
Ok. I can make it a public class with IA.private.

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan Add to branch-1. Probably inappropriate for 0.98.

This looks good for branch-1. I am not sure whether it will break anything in our compat guidelines. I think not, since these new KV's are not propagated to the client, only happens at the server side.

Probably inappropriate for 0.98.

Can you explain the rationale for this statement? I don't see an issue, the new type and it's use is scoped entirely within the server side.
I forgot committing this to branch-1. Here is the patch. Will commit unless objections.

Andrew Purtell
I missed the comment from Stack. I think we can add this to 0.98 also. I was just waiting for your verification but some how I missed this in middle.

Hey ramkrishna.s.vasudevan, let's wait to hear back from stack. In the meantime if you're planning to put up an 0.98 patch, let's do that. Or if not, don't worry, I can port back the branch-1 patch later.

Can you explain the rationale for this statement?

Minor, unquantified perf improvement. Didn't think 0.98 would be interested.

Minor, unquantified perf improvement. Didn't think 0.98 would be interested.

Ok, thanks.
I recall reading on one of these JIRAs that vInt parsing of tag length was prominent in some workloads. Let me profile and see if this patch is useful.

I recall reading on one of these JIRAs that vInt parsing of tag length was prominent in some workloads.

vint of mvcc.
Patch for 0.98. Will commit this to 0.98 and branch-1 unless objections.

In both 0.98 and branch-1 patches
HFileReaderV2
protected Cell formKeyValue() {
Why this is added as protected? I can not see this is extended.
In reader V2 we don't have Tags. Blindly return NoTagsKeyValue then.

In reader V2 we don't have Tags. Blindly return NoTagsKeyValue then.

Ya this is the ideal one.

Why this is added as protected? I can not see this is extended.

This is getting extended in V3.


+      if (currTagsLen > 0) {

+        return formKeyValue();

+      } else {

Now the change would be to formNoTagsKeyValue.
Updated branch-1 patch.
Pushed to branch-1 +
Updated 0.98 patch

Andrew Purtell
You can check this and commit to 0.98 branch. I will leave this open till then. Pls feel feel to close this with or without 0.98 tag.
